intro: Pupalia lappacea var. grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered pupalia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a shrub characterized by its aromatic, glandular leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, hairy fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens for its fragrance and visual appeal.
